This document introduces the user to the [Stellar Wallets Kit]('https://stellarwalletskit.dev/'). The Stellar Wallets Kit is a library that simplifies handling multiple Stellar wallets through a straightforward API. With this kit, you can interact with various wallets without worrying about individual configurations. Developers can focus on UI/UX design while relying on this library for wallet connections.

## Compattible Wallets:

The following wallets are compatible with the Stellar Wallets Kit:

- xBull Wallet (both PWA and extension versions)
- Albedo
- Freighter
- Rabet (extension version)
- WalletConnect
- Lobstr
- Hana

## Installation

To install the library, use npm:

<CodeExample>
  ```bash npm install @creit.tech/stellar-wallets-kit ```
</CodeExample>

## Usage

### Creating an Instance

1. First, create an instance of the `StellarWalletsKit` class. You should only create one instance to avoid unexpected behavior. Hereâ€™s an example:

<CodeExample >
```javascript
import {
  StellarWalletsKit,
  WalletNetwork,
  allowAllModules,
  XBULL_ID,
} from '@creit.tech/stellar-wallets-kit';

const kit = new StellarWalletsKit({ network: WalletNetwork.TESTNET, selectedWalletId: XBULL_ID, modules: allowAllModules(), });

````
</CodeExample>
The `allowAllModules()` function imports modules where no additional configuration is needed (e.g., WalletConnect). If you want to specify only certain wallets to support, pass an array of modules to the constructor like this :
<CodeExample >
```javascript
import {
  FreighterModule,
  StellarWalletsKit,
  WalletNetwork,
  XBULL_ID,
  xBullModule
} from '@creit.tech/stellar-wallets-kit';

const kit: StellarWalletsKit = new StellarWalletsKit({
  network: WalletNetwork.TESTNET,
  selectedWalletId: XBULL_ID,
  modules: [
    new xBullModule(),
    new FreighterModule(),
  ]
});
````

</CodeExample>

## Integrated UI Modal

The library includes a UI modal that you can show your users after initializing the kit. Once they select a wallet, you can use other available methods. Hereâ€™s how to use it:

<CodeExample >
```javascript
await kit.openModal({
  onWalletSelected: async (option) => {
    kit.setWallet(option.id);
    const publicKey = await kit.getPublicKey();
    // Perform additional actions
  },
});
```
</CodeExample>
The `openModal` method allows you to customize the modal title, allowed wallets, and styles.
<CodeExample>
```javascript
function openModal(params: {
    onWalletSelected: (option: ISupportedWallet) => void;
    onClosed?: (err: Error) => void;
    modalDialogStyles?: { [name: string]: string | number | undefined | null; }
    modalTitle?: string;
    notAvailableText?: string;
}) {}
```
</CodeExample>

## How to request the public key and sign transactions

Each wallet has its own way when it comes to both requesting the public key and signing a transaction. The kit allows you perform both actions with a unified API:

<CodeExample>
```javascript
const publicKey = await kit.getPublicKey();

// AND

const { result } = await kit.signTx({ xdr: '....', publicKeys: [publicKey], // You could send multiple public keys in case the wallet needs to handle multi signatures network: WalletNetwork.PUBLIC });

````
</CodeExample>
Both methods  trigger the action using the set wallet before calling those methods.

## Extra methods

There will be moments where you would like to change certain parameters from the kit like the selected wallet, the network, etc... or maybe listening when a WalletConnect session was removed. These methods will help you in those situations:
Set the target wallet
<CodeExample>
```javascript
await kit.setWallet(XBULL_ID)
```

</CodeExample>

Set the target network

<CodeExample>
```javascript
   await kit.setNetwork(WalletNetwork.TESTNET);
```
</CodeExample>

And for more methods, check the [documentation]('https://stellarwalletskit.dev/') to see all the methods available.
````
